recent_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
recent_posts.summary:
- Two papers criticized for incorrect assumptions about Bitcoin's security model.
- Assumption of trustless out-of-band payments with oracles or altchains deemed unrealistic.
- Bitcoin's security relies on maintaining nash equilibrium with miners, prevents censorship and reorganizations.

recent_posts.title: BIP for Serverless Payjoin
recent_posts.summary:
- The BIP now includes a DH cryptosystem with a recipient using only public key.
- This change was made following Adam's comments to enhance security.
- The aim is to balance convenience and protection against the risk of losing funds.

recent_posts.title: BIP for Serverless Payjoin (AdamISZ)
recent_posts.summary:
- The email suggests that URIs are better than other options for displaying QR codes.
- QR libraries treat binary data, which increases QR density, regardless of the encoding used.
- UR encoding is recommended for efficient QR codes, and it can animate large data.

recent_posts.title: Resumable channels using OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
recent_posts.summary:
- The proposal introduces a new way to make lightning channels resumable from a wallet seed.
- It addresses channel backup issues and introduces a type of channel funding transaction.
- The proposal includes asymmetric roles, fraud proofs, and suggestions for saving bandwidth.

recent_posts.title: Multipath Keysend
recent_posts.summary:
- Revisit post-PTLCs scenario; consider making classic keysend MPP for CLN and LDK.
- It would be beneficial for others to support this feature as well.
- Senders consider payment claimed once sent, even if recipient claims less.

recent_posts.title: Specification Meeting Transcripts
recent_posts.summary:
- The team has been recording and transcribing bi-weekly specification meetings since the start of the year.
- The records are shared for others' use and can be accessed at https://btctranscripts.com/lightning-specification.
- Gurwinder from Chaincode manually checks the transcripts for accuracy.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- We're implementing 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains, ensuring server remains 'blinded'.
- Party 1 won't learn aggregate public key, signature, or message being signed.
- Security in blinded statechains depends on trusting the server's reporting of partial signatures.

active_posts.title: Ark: An Alternative Privacy-preserving Second Layer Solution
active_posts.summary:
- The Ark protocol, a new second-layer design, allows users to send and receive funds without liquidity constraints.
- Ark uses virtual UTXOs and consumes less on-chain footprint than Lightning, without channels.
- Users acquire vTXOs from others or lift their on-chain UTXOs for anonymous, off-chain payments.

active_posts.title: BIP-352 Silent Payments addresses should have an expiration time
active_posts.summary:
- Wallets can be compromised, leading to addresses becoming toxic, risking lost funds.
- Silent Payments allow safe multiple payments, but addresses should eventually expire to avoid mistakes.
- Adding an expiration date to addresses through a 3-byte or 2-byte field is proposed.

active_posts.title: Jamming Mitigation Dry Run
active_posts.summary:
- We are proceeding with the plan discussed at the summit for a "dry run" of HTLC endorsement and local reputation tracking.
- The plan includes collecting forwarding data, propagating an experimental TLV, and implementing local reputation algorithms.
- Privacy is prioritized, and node operators are encouraged to participate in data collection.

active_posts.title: LN Summit 2023 Notes
active_posts.summary:
- The annual specification meeting took place in New York City in late June.
- Transcript-style notes of the meeting can be found at this link: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MZhAH82YLEXWz4bTnSQcdTQ03FpH4JpukK9Pm7V02bk/edit?usp=sharing.
- Gratitude was expressed to attendees and hosts for their contributions during the meeting.

active_posts.title: Blinded Paths Doom Scenario
active_posts.summary:
- Blinded paths in the Lightning Network provide privacy benefits for receiving nodes.
- Payments can only be made through the given paths, possibly favoring compliant nodes.
- Concerns include decreased decentralization, compromised sender-side privacy, and pressure from chain analysis companies.
